lead_paragraph: The rule, which is estimated to directly affect more than 1.1 million people, will enable workers to accrue up to seven days for medical care for themselves or relatives.

byline.contributor: Michael Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Require Its Contractors to Provide Paid Sick Leave
headline.main: U.S. Will Require Its Contractors to Provide Paid Sick Leave

snippet: The rule, which is estimated to directly affect more than 1.1 million people, will enable workers to accrue up to seven days for medical care for themselves or relatives....
abstract: Obama administration announces federal government contractors will be required to provide sick leave to their workers employed under contracts solicited by government beginning January 1, 2017; rule allows works to accrue up to 56 hours of leave annually to use for illness, caring for sick relative or dealing with domestic violence or sexual assault; new rule is expected to affect 1.1 million people.
